title: Bixi adds gesture controls to any smart device on the cheap – Kickstarter of the week | Trusted Reviews
description:

morning](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-

**Every week we scour Kickstarter, Indiegogo and more to find the best
crowdfunding projects around, so you know which ones to consider backing – and
which to avoid.**

The week’s pick is
[Bixi](https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1860920533/bixi-control-any-smart-
device-by-simply-waving-you?ref=home_popular), a nifty little unit that lets
you add gesture control functionality to a wide range of smart devices. And
our one to avoid? More on that later, but let’s just say for now it quite
literally belongs in the toilet.

**Related:[Remix IO is a 4K HDR Android media box that does it
all](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/remix-io-is-an-android-running-all-
in-one-media-device-making-it-our-kickstarter-of-the-week)**

## What is Bixi?

![bixi
cooking](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Bixi is a sensor that lets you add hands-free commands to a whole bunch of
devices. Touchscreens? Sure, they’re great, but they’re not ideal in all
situations, which is where gesture controls come in.

Cooking and want to scroll to the next part of a recipe without muddying your
£600 phone? No problem. Don’t want to take your eyes off the road to take a
call driving? Very sensible. Can’t fiddle with audio controls when cycling?
Now you don’t have to.

These are just some of the things Bixi can help you do with nothing more than
the wave of a hand, so let’s dive a little deeper.

## Why is it interesting?

Because it’s so versatile. You can use it with apps, LifX smart lightbulbs,
Bose Soundtouch speakers, GoPro cameras, tablets, and all sorts of Internet of
Things devices.

Not only that, it can control multiple actions at the same time, so you can
ride your bike with Bixi on both Music and GoPro profiles, and control your
tunes and action cam with just a wave of the hand.

![bixi
bike](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

It will even display turn-by-turn directions using the LEDs, meaning it
doubles as a handlebar-mounted bike sat-nav, and is ideal for the car as it
means you can use all your in-car gadgets without taking your eyes off the
road.

Plus, it works with Apple TV, Philips Hue, Spotify, Sonos, Sony TV, Nest,
Kindle, Deezer and more. Basically, it’s your ticket to a hands-free
household.

**Related:[SkunkLock makes bike thieves vomit in their scummy
steps](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/skunklock-is-a-bike-lock-that-
sprays-thieves-with-a-vomit-inducing-deterrent-making-it-our-kickstarter-of-
the-week)  
**  
So how does the magic happen? Bixi works on the principle of [If This Then
That (IFTTT)](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ifttt-tutorial-guide-
applets), so when it’s set to control one device, certain gestures act as
certain triggers to activate an action.

Waving up will scroll down your smartphone’s screen, for example, while
raising your hand will increase the volume of the song that’s playing.

![bixi
main](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Once it’s registered your hand gesture, it sends a Bluetooth Low Energy signal
to the Bixi app on your smartphone, which then reads the signal and sends a
command to your paired device either through Bluetooth or Wi-Fi.

It detects hand movements up to 25cm in front of itself, so you don’t need to
be close to use it, and pairing is a doddle, too – just tap Pair, choose your
profiles and hit Sync. That’s it.

The battery should also last a long time before needing recharging. According
to the makers, it’ll go for between three weeks to two months when always
connected.

## What are the challenges?

![bixi
office](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Crowdfunding is a risky business. When you back a project, you’re not buying
it like you would from Amazon, but rather giving financial assistance to the
team making it.

In most cases, things go smoothly and backers get their products but there’s
no guarantees, so consult the [Kickstarter Backer
FAQs](https://www.kickstarter.com/help/faq/backer+questions) if you’re unsure
about how things work.

**Related:[The MVR Ascend is a British-made Gear VR
rival](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/the-mvr-ascend-h1-lets-you-
play-gta-5-in-vr-on-ps4-xbox-one-and-pc-immerse-yourself-in-this-week-s-
featured-kickstarter)**

Common roadblocks include supply shortages and production issues, but the team
behind Bixi say they’re on target to deliver the first pre-series units on
time. Fingers crossed things stay that way.

The pre-series units should go out in January, but early bird backers won’t
get theirs until March.

## Is there anything similar available?

![bixi
painting](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Yes. Leap Motion, Myo and Fibaro Home Intelligence all do a similar job, but
Bixi is the only one that’s ultra-portable, robust enough to use outdoors, has
built-in gesture processing, and still manages to sound simple to use.

**Related:[AER lets you lob your GoPro into the
air](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/aer-lets-you-lob-your-gopro-into-the-
air-and-is-our-kickstarter-of-the-week)**

With early birds starting at $79 (£63), it’s also one of the more affordable
options.

## Should I crowdfund this?

If it makes reading a recipe on your phone easier while cooking, we’re all in
favour, as we’ve lost count of the number of times our phone has been covered
in flour.

One step up from the $79 early bird is the home and car package, which costs
$119 (£95). This gives you two Bixis – one for your home, and one for your
car. Of course, you can use them anywhere you like, such as on your bike, for
instance.

## And our one to avoid…  

![illumibowl
2.0](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

[IllumiBowl
2.0](https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1585372093/illumibowl-2-toilet-
night-light-sharktank-upgrade?ref=category_popular). Yes, these light-up
toilet seats are still around, about 10 years after they first surfaced. If
you can’t find the toilet on your own you don’t deserve to be in charge of
money.
